name: Luigi Russolo
description: '''Luigi Carlo Filippo Russolo''' (30 April 1885 – 4 February 1947) was an Italian [[Futurism|Futurist]] painter, composer, builder of [[experimental musical instrument]]s, and the author of the manifesto ''[[The Art of Noises]]'' (1913).{{sfn|Chilvers|Glaves-Smith|2009|p=619}} Russolo completed his secondary education at Seminary of Portogruaro in 1901, after which he moved to Milan and began gaining interest in the arts. He is often regarded as one of the first [[noise music]] [[experimental music|experimental]] composers with his performances of ''noise music concerts'' in 1913–14 and then again after World War I, notably in Paris in 1921.{{sfn|Chilvers|Glaves-Smith|2009|p=620}} He designed and constructed a number of noise-generating devices called [[Intonarumori]].
